Technique: PRESSED IN A FORM/MODEL; FORMED BY HAND
Name: Bracelet
Description: String of faience tubular beads, with three small amulets, perhaps derived from the udjat-eye, symbol of health. It was found in the intact burial of a woman, in one of four chambers cut from a shaft in the rock, beneath the largest of a series of 12th Dynasty offering-chapels in the middle of the north cemetery at Abydos ('cemetery S'). Other items of jewellery buried with the woman and in other, plundered burials in the same shaft tomb, are also now in Dublin, numbers NMI 1912.173 to 181.
